channel.title: steam locks up
channel.description: Since today my steam just locks up, right after the start wehn it wants to load the store page. I already tried to delete anything of steam except steam.exe itself and steamapps. I remember that I already had this issue, but can't remember the reason. So, what else could I do to get it working again?

item.title: steam locks up
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
ok, platform.gcf wasn’t the problem, it seems like the “dystopia live content.gcf” caused the lock ups

Read full topic

item.title: steam locks up
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Actually, try deleting platform.gcf in the first place.

item.title: steam locks up
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Start renaming or moving the files and folders inside the steamapps folder until you find the culprit.

but only since today.
how can a corrupted gcf/ncf lock up steam?

Steam doesn’t like one of your games, perhaps?

item.title: steam locks up

item.description:
hm, if I rename the steamapps folder and start steam then it works…

Read full topic

item.title: steam locks up
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
Well if you already eradicated yourself of all the blobs you can try a reinstall. Move your steam apps folder out, uninstall steam, reinstall and move the steam apps folder back.

Read full topic

item.title: steam locks up
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
I remember it once fixing itself with the next update for me.
Here’s for hoping it fixes itself for you too.
